questions.Q: What was the name of the imaginary village created by Christopher Isherwood along with his friend and long term associate Edward Upward?

To which country did Christopher Isherwood flee to along with his friend in the peak year of 1933?
Which of these plays was not written by Christopher Isherwood and his friend W.H Auden?
Which of these novels depicted a day in the life of an Englishman who was also a homosexual written by Christopher Isherwood?
Which of these by Christopher Isherwood is a fictionalized autobiography?
Arthur Norris, the protagonist of the novel Mr Norris Changes Trains meets the narrator while travelling from where to where?
How many short stories did Christopher Isherwood include in his work Goodbye to Berlin?
To which country did the famous critical theorist and poet Leopold Senghor belong?
In which place did the famous movement of Negritude emerge and was led by Leopold Senghor and Aime Cesaire?
What does the critical term used by Leopold Senghor -‘Decalage’ mean?
O: Equality in Aesthetics of Black Africans and African Americans
Gap of thought between French and Africans

questions.Q: For which poem did Edward Upward receive the Chancellor’s Medal for Verse?
